title: thresh + relic shield
body: as an adc nothing tilts me more than when a thresh tries to cs with relic shield and miss  judges the health resulting in the minion dying to my minions and nobody geting gold for it, would it be possible if riot could increase his execute damage threshold because this is becoming to be a joke. hes a good champ and cant cs for shit. plz halp {{item:3302}}  {{item:3046}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
As a thresh main, nothing tilts me more then seeing an adc last hit when I'm trying to get melee + cannons.
Thresh E (flay) gains more dmg over time, once used it resets.

But that's hard when the adc keeps getting into fights.
and I'm forced to help, instead of helping them gain gold - EXP and farm.

Relic shield's passive of executing minions does not work on thresh as he is ranged.
It only works with melee attacks.
Why people can take relic on him is because of his E passive.

as a thresh main nothing tilts me more than when my adc fucks with cs so that I can't use relic on melee and cannons only. Too often does an adc clear out a wave then ping the remaining 1 or two ranged CS minions and expect me to auto them for the relic proc. Would it be possible if riot could increase add the tool-tip "relic shield gives more gold to your team if you allow your support to kill melee and cannon minions" as a tooltip instead of how long it takes for you to get from fountain to fountain using only flash. plz halp

It's pretty clear within the first couple of waves if your thresh can predict his damage and properly utilise his E passive in terms of getting his relic shield stacks. 

By this time you should also be able to judge how much he misses by, and perhaps throw out an ability or an AA to catch the minion before it dies (after he tried to get it). After the game, add the player and **kindly** suggest they try a bot game or something with targons thresh so they can get better at predicting. 

Like others have said, Thresh doesn't get the relic execute passive as he is technically considered a "ranged" champion.
or you could ask them kindly to buy an ancient coin instead. That said, the way a thresh manages their relic shield does give you an indicator of how much you can expect from their thresh mechanics.

I mean i'm a pretty decent thresh, but i still buy coin for the simple fact that you most of the time want CDR asap, and coin allows that. (40% CDR and Sightstone ends up being 4300 gold + pots and control wards.)

and the fact that talisman of ascension is arguably one of the best item actives in the game, especially with thresh when you want to be able to make picks and get up close and personal with the enemy.
Thresh cannot use hhe execute as he is classified as ranged not melee. So changing the "execute damage threshold" will do nothing to help Thresh anyway....
